context: The column effluent was introduced into the mass spectrometer via a fused-silica capillary (0.1mm i.d.×0.190mm o.d.). A sample loop of 20μl was used. 2.6.2 Observational study in children with asthma LTB4 concentrations in EBC were measured with a Finnigan Surveyor® LC System pump coupled with a TSQ Quantum Ultra™ triple quadrupole mass spectrometer (Thermo Electron Corporation, San José, USA). LC/ESI-MS/MS analysis was performed in negative ion polarity mode by choosing m/z 335 as precursor ion. The analytical conditions were similar to those described in the methodological study. Chromatography was performed on a BetaBasic C18 column (15cm×2.1mm

llm_generation.summary: In this context, Leukotriene B4 (LTB4) is analyzed in the exhaled breath condensate (EBC) of children with asthma. The study aims to measure LTB4 concentrations using advanced mass spectrometry techniques, indicating a potential role of LTB4 as a biomarker or mediator in asthma pathophysiology. The focus on LTB4 suggests its relevance in the inflammatory processes associated with asthma, although specific findings on its impact are not detailed in the provided text.
